column1: back of a length delivery on middle, defended
short ball around off, gets it to climb and squares up Khawaja who keeps it out
drifts down a length ball around his leg stumps at 140kph, grazes the pad after beating the attempted flick and goes down to short fine leg
gets on top of this short ball outside off and nudges it away in the direction of short leg
short of a length on off, tucks it in front of mid-on for a quick single
back of a length outside off, presses forward and punches into the covers
short of a length, slight shape away from the batsman, covers the line and punches into the cover and point region
shots of catch it but safe. Comes down the track and heaves this length ball with the angle but on the bounce to deep square leg running in
fullish length on the pads, clips it on its way to square leg as it beats an attempted flick

short of a length, sits nicely around the top of off and Khawaja swivels around and pulls to the right of deep midwicket who runs across, slides and pulls it back but not forcefully enough as the ball trickles back over
back of a length around middle and leg, pushed down the ground. Mid-on runs across and slips, mid-off tidies up after him
back of a length, tucked into the on side
shortish around off, gets on top of it and punches into the covers
slow yorker on off, guided to point
short of a length outside off, gets on top and flicks it wide of midwicket
heaved straight over. A slightly back of a length ball, angles away from him late and that gives Khawaja the requisite room
poor delivery. Short ball, leg side line, swivels around and crunches a pull through backward of square leg
has that hit the stumps? No, seems like that was Bancroft's gloves. He made contact with the stumps even as Patterson crunches a late cut through point
sliding fuller ball, angling on his leg stump and Khawaja gets down for a big slog and skews it off the inside of the bat through deep backward square leg
almost runs him out. Advances down the ground and yorks himself. Can only dig it out and the keeper charges forward but fumbles and allows him to get back
leg side fuller ball, slogs it hard through square leg for four
overcompensates with the line and floats up a fuller delivery outside off, inside his swinging arc and he crunches it over long-off
starts off with a back of a length delivery on middle that is pulled wide of midwicket
short of a length, slanted across on off, drags a pull to mid-on
just over cover. Backs away to a shortish delivery and slaps it hard and over the cover fielder leaping back with his hands outstretched
gets hit on the pad as he looks to heave this one but it drifts into him and strikes the pad

gets a clear edge through to the keeper. Tries to manufacture some room and slash a cut but there is no pace and Patterson has to force a slap. Gets a clean edge to the keeper. A wicket for Kelly in his first BBL over
length ball, pats it with the angle to square leg
full around off, driven to mid-off
shot, what a sweep shot. SHort of a length, pitches outside leg and comes on around middle and Khawaja swivels around with a pull over deep midwicket
full outside off, comes forward and crunches it to mid-off
advances down the ground and makes some room. Just gets a little too far away from the ball and as a result, heaves it off the bottom of the bat over the in-field. Doesn't carry
short ball down the leg side, pulled behind square leg
full on the pads, flicked off them to backward square leg
fuller ball, presses forward and eases it into the off side
backs away to a back of a length delivery and chops a cut into the covers
too short and too much power. Banged in halfway down and Watson shovels a pull to beat the man at deep midwicket quite comfortably
again backs away and now he slaps it down to long-off
a little bit of width but not short enough. Khawaja shifts back and pulls to the midwicket region
length ball on leg stump, whipped away to midwicket
short of a length on off, defended
fullish length, curving in round middle, whipped away through the midwicket region. Watson wants a second and take on the fielder but is sent back by an unresponsive Khawaja. Safe in the end
short of a length, pitching outside leg, nudged to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, now Khawaja calls himself, for a quick single as the ball trickles away to short fine leg
shapes up for a pull to a short of a length delivery and gets an inside edge onto the pad
dipping fuller ball on middle and leg, whipped into the leg side
what sort of a ridiculous shot is that! Paris drags the length back as Khawaja walks across but then ramps it well over the fine leg region with a paddle
short of a length, gets inside it and tucks it away to short fine leg

short ball, pulls it away behind square and the ball trickles down on the bounce to deep fine leg. The fielder in the deep makes a save diving in front of the stumps. They go upstairs to check and he has done fine
a leg side length ball, Watson throws hard hands and gets a bit of a glove on the way to deep fine leg
slower full toss, flayed to point
fullish, straight on the pads, heaved over the fine leg region

Watson skies a catch to long-off. Chips a really slow delivery in the air. Doesn't pick the lack in pace and goes for the big heave. Caught at long-off as he chips in it the air off the toe-end of the bat
there is no relent from Khawaja. Brings up his fifty with a full, mighty swing over long-off
overcompensation with the length. Khawaja is playing well off either foot or throwing the bowlers off guard. A short ball that's been hammered over square leg with a pull
another overcompensation with the length. Full toss outside off, driven to point who makes a diving save
tucks it with the turn to square leg
looks to flick and gets an inside edge to the pad
flatter trajectory and pushed across him, Khawaja shimmies down the ground and meets the pitch before lofting it big over long-on
full, outside off, eased out down to long-off
fullish delivery, curving into middle,
slashes at the sight of width and carves it away to point
walks across towards off and tucks a short of a length delivery behind square
slower full ball outside off, punch-driven to long-off
length ball, shaping into him, walks across and puches down o long-on
some width on offer outside off, flayed to sweeper cover with a half-angled bat
shortish, cuts into him and he gets an outside edge as he tries to force a shot through the off side. Outside edge runs down to third man where Johnson slides but makes a bad mess of a simple save
full, angled across a set of stumps outside off, pushed into the covers
full and drifting down the leg side, Ferguson misses with the attempted flick
yorker on middle and leg, dug out
backs away to a short ball but the line follows him and tucks him up. Extra bounce carries the ball over Khawaja's swishing blade

another misfield. Good gracious, how many of those have we seen today? These are unusually shoddy fielding standards for a tournament in Australia. Steps down the track and heaves a fuller ball on the bounce to deep midwicket who comes forward and fumbles
slashes a fuller delivery to the off side
drifts down the leg side and the ball goes on the bounce to the keeper. No wide call so must have been some bat on the attempted glance
stumping chance. Khawaja advanced and yorked himself. Bancroft closed his gloves early and does not collect the ball
full toss, slanted across outside off and Khawaja gets down for a reverse sweep through short third man
worked away to backward square leg
stays back to a length ball and flicks into midwicket
full and pushed across outside off, Khawaja gets down for a big slog and mistimes it to deep midwicket
flat and slightly shorter, whips it away to midwicket
short of a length, slower at 114kph, stops on him a bit and he uppishly drops it into the leg side
short of a length, outside off, hangs back and drops it to point
tries to upper cut a short delivery but gets beaten by the extra bounce
full, angling in around middle and off, heaved over backward square leg
wide yorker, jams the bat down and makes no contact. Wide called but seems a harsh call
short of a length, not much pace again and stops on him as he gets squared up and sends an outside edge towards short third man
slower length ball, gets on top and punches to midwicket
slides in with the arm on middle, fractionally short, Ferguson skips back and muscles a pull to deep backward square leg
dragged down on middle stump, now it's Khawaja's turn to muscle a pull roughly in the direction of cow corner

Agar has Khawaja holing out to backward point. Agar holds this back outside off and gets this to angle away. Nice drop in pace. Khawaja throws his hands at the ball only to slice an outside edge to Klinger. No hundred for Khawaja
full and sliding away outside off, past the outside edge
full and straight, tapped down to long-on
slid in on middle and leg, 93ks, whipped away to wide long-on
full and cutting away outside off, this slower one floats past the outside edge

short ball aimed at the arm-pit, Ferguson takes it on with a hook and skies it. Bosisto runs to his right from deep square leg, but the ball keeps spinning away from his reach. He brings out a brave dive but the ball drops short. A+ for commitment
just short of a good length and outside off, that's flashed away to backward point
middle-stump yorker, backs away and carves the ball to the covers for one
overpitched and speared into the pads, glanced away fine on the leg side. Roher simply tickled it away
Johnson caps off with spell with a rip-roaring middle-stump yorker, which is dug back down the pitch
full, slanted across outside off, drilled between mid-on and midwicket for a brace
short of a length on middle and leg, pulls out to deep square leg
back of a length, keeps a little low around off, pulls it along the ground wide of deep midwicket
full and too easy on middle and leg. Just heaves it over for four to the left of long-on

holes out this time and it's the lack of pace that does him in. A short of a length delivery that comes on at minimal pace around off and Ferguson has to muster all the power he can. Hits it straight into the hands of deep midwicket
slower full ball outside off, knocks it into the gap between cover and point
full, angling in on middle and leg, heaved over on the bounce to long-on

dropped. Another sitter put down. The fielding standards haven't been up to the mark this season but tonight has been especially lousy. Walks down to a short ball and is rushed into a pull which he top-edges to short fine leg where Ashton Turner reverse-cups and puts it down
full and angling in, clipped to deep midwcket
stands in the crease and swings big to a delivery that comes into him and misses
slower short ball, takes his eyes off as he tries to hook and gets beaten
comes into the pads at a fuller length and hits it on its way to short fine leg
full and wide, squeezed out through point

stunning effort For a change! A short ball sitting up on middle and off. Rohrer pulls over square leg and Bosisto jumps up full length while arching back a little. Catches the ball and sees the momentum carrying him over so he lets go of the ball in time before stepping out of the field of play. Top effort!
beaten by lack of pace as he swings and misses
short and wide, slaps it straight over and the ball crashes to the right of the sightscreen
walks across a long way towards off and the bowler fires it full and follows him, doesn't middle a paddle too well and knocks it to short fine leg
backs away to a fuller ball and goes inside-out as he crunches a drive to sweeper cover. Wants the second but is forced to settle for the one
short of a length, some shape away there, reaches out and guides to third man by opening the face very late
full, angling in and straightening around middle, flicked to midwicket for a quick single
length ball outside off, walks across to get behind the line and flicks to midwicket
short of a length outside off, opens the face and drops it to point
back of a length on middle and leg, closes the face and gets hit on the front thigh. Played the shot early as the pace was slower
walks down and the bowler drags the length back. Adjusts well by pulling behind square to backward square leg. A little fumble allows a second
full on the stumps, no pace, defended back
fullish on the stumps, heaves it across the line and clears midwicket with ease
walks across outside off to meet the line and pushes it back to the bowler

oh, dear! A nothing short ball that he really could have hit anywhere. What does Bosisto do? He swivels around, middles and times it all well. But placement? Oh, I'm afraid it ain't too great. Hits it straight into the hands of short fine leg
short of a length, drifts very sharply down the leg side
short of a length, fishes outside the off-stump and knocks it to third man off the outside of the bat
short of a length, down the leg side, very closely misses the glance on its way to the keeper who excitedly appeals. But there is no bat involved
beats him with a ripper. Has him all squared up with a short of a length ball that climbs onto him and nips away to rip past the outside edge
full ball on leg stump, can't swipe it away, dug back to the bowler
good length on middle stump, going straight through across the right hander, pushes at it away from his body, takes the outside edge, and Fawad can't stop this from going past him
full on middle stump, driven straight down the ground, stopped by Green
good length on middle stump, backs away and turns this off his pads to deep backward square
on middle stump once again, nudged around the corner on the leg side for a single
full on middle stump, driven back to the bowler
good length on off stump, nips slightly away from Bancroft as he tries to punch back, goes past his edge through to the keeper
good length just outside off, Bancroft walked across to the right side to work it off his pads, but mistimes his shot. Tapped towards midwicket as the bat turns in his hands
slightly full outside off, Klinger backs away and carves this over the off side. Played over point, rather safe
good length on off stump, angling into the batsman's body, tries to play this fine down the leg side, but can't get bat to ball. Dribbles down the leg side off his thigh pad

another beauty outside off, good length outside off and angling further away from the right-hander's back-foot punch. Misses the shot once again. Not much footwork on this occasion, a big gap between bat and body
back of a length on off stump, and angling into his pads, tries to flick off his pads but extra bounce deceives the batsman.  Hits him near his knee-roll in front of middle stump
good length on off stump, no spin on offer as the batsman goes deep into his crease to cut, but misses. Too close to his body

full on off stump and Klinger tries to lift this over the infield. Can't get under the ball, as he drives straight down. Shouts of 'catch it' and the ball is pocketed by mid off from in front of his face. Not hit well enough by Klinger, he's got to go
full on middle stump, Turner backed away towards the leg side with a big wind up, but chooses to drive along the ground to cover instead
good length on leg stump, bit slower on this occasion, Turner backs away but the offspin follows him. Punched to cover
low full toss on leg stump, bunted back down the ground but sharply stopped by Green on his followthrough. Stops a definite run, if not more

tossed up full on middle stump, smacked down the ground past the bowler's right. Rohrer, at long on, does well to cover the ground but fluffs the take. Ricochets off his body and into the long-on boundary. Scrappy work in the deep that dilutes an an otherwise tight over
good length on off stump, tapped past midwicket off the front foot, calls early for the second and completed with ease
good length wide outside off, Turner shuffles across to the off side but punches this square with soft hands. Goes to point

it's the slower ball, and Turner's been foxed! Full ball on off stump, but with all the pace taken off it. Loopy delivery that dips fast and Turner misses the flick off his toes. Crashes into his back boot in front of off stump, and the umpire has no hesitation to raise his finger
full on off stump, driven down the ground off the front foot, played firmly to mid off
full on off stump and shaping away, driven off the front foot, and fielded by cover courtesy a sharp dive to his right
full on middle stump, uses his wrists to flick this behind past the square-leg umpire. There's protection in the deep, though
good length on middle stump, attempted legspinner but going down the leg side, but the batsman turns it to short third man off the back foot

through him! Terrific wrong'un to get rid of Voges. Good-length ball outside off and it spins into the batsman as he tries to drive away from his body, sneaks through the gap between bat and pad, and crashes into middle stump. A legspinner's dream wicket
full on off stump, firmly hit down the ground to the man at long off, they take off for a walking single
floated full on middle and leg, tapped off the front foot past the non-striker to mid on
back of a length on middle stump, the batsman shimmies down the ground but can't get under the delivery, turned off his pads towards midwicket
good length just outside off, Cartwright stays deep in his crease and punches off the back foot. Inside edge ricochets onto his body
back of a length wide outside off, cut off the back foot between cover and point, well stopped by the infielder but can't stop the batsmen from racing across
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot past cover, cleaned up by deep extra cover near the boundary
tossed up full outside off, muscled down the ground past the non-striker, work for the fielder at the long-on boundary
back of a length outside off, rocks back and punches past cover once again. Takes the single from the only available gap on the off side
back of a length outside off, tries to carve this square but mistimed. The ball goes nowhere
good length on middle stump, shuffles across to the off side and taps this off his pads. Nudged to deep midwicket off the back foot
full on off stump, the batsman dances down the wicket but can't get under the delivery. Driven to long on
flatter ball, back of a length on off stump, carved off the back foot past cover point
tossed up full on middle stump, flicked off his toes to deep midwicket. Twenty-one balls since the last boundary
good length outside off, zips straight through as the ball generates some extra bounce off the surface. Misses the cut shot, as the ball goes over his blade. Sharp take from the keeper
good length outside off, backs away and cuts along the carpet past point. Still dealing only in singles
full on middle and leg, the batsman comes down the ground but the bowler follows his line, can't get bat to ball as the delivery hits his front leg
almost a medium-pacer's delivery there, short outside off and that's been pulled off the back foot. Off the bat's middle and it threads the men between cow corner and deep midwicket
full on middle stump, hit back down the ground
full on off stump, muscled towards long-on off the front foot. No real timing
full outside off, extravagantly driven off the front foot past cover
back of a length on middle stump, spins into the batsman. Can't turn this off his pads fine down the leg side. Hits his thigh pad instead
good length on off stump, tapped off the front foot to cover, but there's no run on offer. Another good over, sans that first loose ball
good length on off stump, cramps the batsman for room. Played back to Fawad
good length on middle stump, comes down the ground and taps it to cow corner
Straight of the long-on boundary! Loopy ball on off stump and Bancroft manages to get under this delivery. Lifted beautifully over the bowler's head
good length on middle stump, worked off his pads to short fine leg

misses the stumping! Good length outside off as the bastman comes down the ground, once again sneaks between his bat and body, but the extra bounce deceives the keeper too. Can't grab it, as the ball flies away off his gloves
full on middle stump, firmly driven down the ground to long on
full on middle and leg, played past the bowler off the front foot, trickles down to long on
good length on middle stump, angling across the right hander as he cuts this square, flies past point. Cartwright prefers the ball coming onto the bat
good length on middle stump, tries a cross-batted slog, but mistimed to deep midwicket. They need to hurry for the second, but it's sharply completed

short outside off and it's a slower short ball, tries to muscle this inside-out over cover, but it's not timed well. Khawaja is running back, but can't hold onto the catch. Manages to get some fingertips to it, but dropped!
good length outside off, punched off the back foot to cover, but Khawaja puts in a sliding effort
pulled and it's gone! Short on middle stump and it's smacked emphatically off the back foot. The ball soars over the man at deep midwicket. Beautiful sound off the bat
overpitched just outside off, almost a yorker-ball. Muscled down the ground to long off
good length on off stump, zips across his body away from Cartwright, tries to drive but the ball goes past his outside edge. The keeper quickly removes the bails, but the back foot was in
juicy full toss on leg stump but Bancroft can't slog this away. Smacks him on his back leg but it was outside leg stump
Rohrer drops it! It's a skyer going to long on, but the fielder drops it after racing in. Full on off stump and the mistimed drive went straight up
full on middle and this time it's a sixer! Pinged over the non-striker's head and Rohrer sees the ball sail over his head. Lands in the crowd
full on middle stump, muscled towards the on side after coming down the ground. It's hit very well, and beats the two men at long on and deep midwicket. Powerfully struck
full ball on off stump, punched down the ground to long off
full on off stump, walks across to the off side and taps it to midwicket with soft hands
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to cover point. Stays slightly low on this occasion
full on middle stump, tries to paddle sweep fine and gets a feather touch off his shot. Goes past the keeper's right and Fawad makes a mess at the fine-leg boundary
full on middle stump, turned off his toes to the leg side
tossed up on off stump, bunted down the ground back to the bowler
full on leg stump, the batsman shimmies down the ground but ends up cramping himself, squeezed away to midwicket
back of a length outside off, goes straight through to the keeper as the batsman misses the cut shot
full on off stump, comes down the ground and hits firmly past cover off the front foot
full on leg stump once again, the batsman whips this off his pads to deep backward square on this occasion. No boundaries yet
loopy ball on off stump, big wind up from Cartwright but driven only along the ground to long off

full on middle stump and it's smacked down the ground. Hit too straight in fact, as the ball breaks the stumps at the non-striker's. A shot deserving of a boundary, but it's not too be. Only four conceded off the over

back of a length outside off, goes deep into the crease and tries to punch off the back foot, thick outside edge takes it to short third man. Tight run at the non-striker's, but completed safely in the end
full on off stump, shimmies down the ground and smacks this to the man at long off
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot past cover
good length outside off, and pulled square. Stays low but still enough wood behind that shot. Races into the cow-corner boundary
back of a length outside off, cut behind point to the deep
back of a length outside off, spins into the batsman's body. Tries to cut, but too close to his body to find any direction. Hit straight to short third man
good length outside off, and Cartwright pounces onto that width. Cut away from his body past the diving fielder at point for a boundary
full on middle stump, gets down on one knee to sweep but misses the shot, can't stop the batsmen from taking the run though
full toss on leg stump on this occasion, bunts his cross-batted shot to wide long on
tossed up full outside off, and it's smacked! Powerfully sent into the stands in front of cow-corner. Big stride forward and full follow through of the bat

waist-high full toss on leg stump, and it's lifted to deep backward square. McClenaghan prepares to take the catch in the deep, but the ball dips on him. The fielder dives forward, but fluffs the catch. Dropped!
And the drop is followed up with a six once again. Full on off stump and it's muscled into the leg side. Off the middle of the bat as it flies into the deep midwicket boundary. Big over

yorker way outside off, tries to drive at it but takes the inside edge off his bat. Goes fine down the leg side instead. The keeper was following the ball, and can't change directions in time. That's the 100-run partnership
overpitched on off stump, dug away to mid on for a single
full and wide outside off, smacked back down the ground past the non-striker to long off
full and wide outside off, too wide for the batsman to reach at it but it stays inside the tram lines. A crucial dot
full on off stump and it's smacked past cover. Work for long off, but quick release from the fielder there. Tight at the non-striker's, but Cartwright hustles in
wayward ball wide outside off, bounces after crossing the batsman. Missed the delivery completed
full and wide outside off once again, but goes over the off-side wide line. The umpire has no hesitation to call extras

full on off stump and it's carved towards the off side. Mistimed shot that's lifted over the infield, falls wells short of long off. Bancroft should be glad he didn't time that shot any better. Would've gone straight down the fielder's throat
yorker first up on middle stump, muscled down the ground to long off. Great start to the over from Sandhu
full outside off and it's smacked over the non-striker's head. Only a single as the ball goes straight to long on
full on off stump, stays deep in his crease and hits it past Sandhu to long off. Still going to the fielders in the deep
offcutter outside off stump, slower ball this time. Big wind up from Bancroft but he's through his slog way too early. Goes one-bounce to the keeper. Great crunch ball
slow, short ball outside off, Bancroft clears his front leg to slog this over cow corner, but there's no pace off the delivery. Bunts his pull back to the bowler
good length on middle stump, and it's pulled down the ground once again. Hit much better on this occasion, and beats the long-on fielder. Ends the over with a four
starts off with a boundary! Full toss wide outside off and he tries to slog this over cover, takes the inside edge as it flies past the keeper's left. Races away to the fine leg boundary

Hits the roof! Full on off stump and that's a huuuuuuge six! Rocks back, clears his front leg, and smacks this over long on. Hits the roof on the full. Whoa, a biggie. And the ball has taken some hammering, we need a new ball
full and wide outside off, down on one knee and smacked inside out past cover, work for the man at deep extra cover, but intercepted.
waist-high full toss outside off, smacked over cover's head for two. The square-leg umpire calls it a no ball. A fair call in a crunch situation
full toss wide outside off, smacked it cross-batted down the ground to long off. No brainer as they turn around for the second run

full on off stump, muscled down the ground to long off. They race around for the single, and it's a chance for a run out, but the bowler can't grab the ball. Means that's two runs, instead of what would've been a single and a wicket. Five needed off the last ball, four for a super over.
low full toss outside off, and the slog is mistimed to deep midwicket. Only a single on offer and Sydney Thunder win by three runs
